0.text: Bug 75568  ajc changes classfile timestamps even if compilation fails (regression).

1.text: It appears that ajc 1.2 updates a classfile timestamps even if the compilation  fails.

2.text: This breaks the integration with the Ant build system.

4.text: using the  ant "javac" task with the Ajc11CompilerAdapter interface, the compilation may  fail on the first attempt and succeed on the second attempt, - because ajc has  touched the timestamp and Ant hence decides that nothing needs to be recompiled.

5.text: This did not happen in ajc 1.1.

7.text: In the examples/observer folder, run a build:  ajc -sourceroots .

9.text: Edit the "Demo.java" class and insert the line "DONT COMPILE" 3.

11.text: The compiler displays the correct error message  but the Demo.class file has been updated with the compile-time timestamp.
